sp.speaker: COMPANY
sp.l: 1776. New York City

sp.speaker: HAMILTON
sp.l: Pardon me. Are you Aaron Burr, sir?

sp.speaker: BURR
sp.l: That depends. Who’s asking?

sp.speaker: HAMILTON
sp.l: Oh, well, sure, sir
I’m Alexander Hamilton, I’m at your service, sir

l.seg: I have been looking for you

sp.speaker: BURR
sp.l: I’m getting nervous

sp.speaker: HAMILTON
sp.l: Sir…

I heard your name at Princeton. I was seeking an accelerated course of study when I got sort of out of sorts with a buddy of yours. I may have punched him. It’s a blur, sir. He handles the financials?

sp.speaker: HAMILTON
sp.l: Yes!
I wanted to do what you did. Graduate in two, then join the revolution. He looked at me like I was stupid, I’m not stupid
So how’d you do it? How’d you graduate so fast?

l.seg: It was my parents’ dying wish before they passed

sp.speaker: HAMILTON
sp.l: You’re an orphan. Of course! I’m an orphan
God, I wish there was a war!
Then we could prove that we’re worth more
Than anyone bargained for…

sp.speaker: BURR
sp.l: Can I buy you a drink?

sp.speaker: HAMILTON
sp.l: That would be nice

sp.speaker: BURR
sp.l: While we’re talking, let me offer you some free advice
Talk less

sp.speaker: HAMILTON
sp.l: What?

sp.speaker: BURR
sp.l: Smile more

sp.speaker: HAMILTON
sp.l: Ha

sp.speaker: BURR
sp.l: Don’t let them know what you’re against or what you’re for

sp.speaker: HAMILTON
sp.l: You can’t be serious

sp.speaker: BURR
sp.l: You wanna get ahead?

sp.speaker: HAMILTON
sp.l: Yes

sp.speaker: BURR
sp.l: Fools who run their mouths off wind up dead

sp.speaker: LAURENS
sp.l: Yo yo yo yo yo!
What time is it?

sp.speaker: MULLIGAN/LAFAYETTE/LAURENS
sp.l: Show time!

sp.speaker: BURR
sp.l: Like I said…

sp.speaker: LAURENS
sp.l: Show time! Show time! Yo!
I’m John Laurens in the place to be!
Two pints o’ Sam Adams, but I’m workin’ on three, uh!
Those redcoats don’t want it with me!
Cuz I will pop chick-a pop these cops till I’m free!

sp.speaker: LAFAYETTE
sp.l: Oui oui, mon ami, je m’appelle Lafayette!
The Lancelot of the revolutionary set!
I came from afar just to say “Bonsoir!”
Tell the King “Casse toi!” Who’s the best?
C’est moi!

sp.speaker: MULLIGAN
sp.l: Brrrah brraaah! I am Hercules Mulligan
Up in it, lovin’ it, yes I heard ya mother said “Come again?”

sp.speaker: LAFAYETTE/LAURENS
sp.l: Ayyyyy

sp.speaker: MULLIGAN
sp.l: Lock up ya daughters and horses, of course
It’s hard to have intercourse over four sets of corsets…

sp.speaker: LAFAYETTE
sp.l: Wow

sp.speaker: LAURENS
sp.l: No more sex, pour me another brew, son!
Let’s raise a couple more…

sp.speaker: MULLIGAN/LAFAYETTE/LAURENS
sp.l: To the revolution!

sp.speaker: LAURENS
sp.l: Well, if it ain’t the prodigy of Princeton college!

sp.speaker: MULLIGAN
sp.l: Aaron Burr!

sp.speaker: LAURENS
sp.l: Give us a verse, drop some knowledge!

sp.speaker: BURR
sp.l: Good luck with that: you’re takin’ a stand
You spit. I’m ‘a sit. We’ll see where we land

sp.speaker: MULLIGAN/LAFAYETTE
sp.l: Boooo!

sp.speaker: LAURENS
sp.l: Burr, the revolution’s imminent. What do you stall for?

sp.speaker: HAMILTON
sp.l: If you stand for nothing, Burr, what’ll you fall for?

sp.speaker: MULLIGAN/LAFAYETTE/LAURENS
sp.l: Ooh
Who you?
Who you?
Who are you?
Ooh, who is this kid? What’s he gonna do?

event.label: Hamilton Interested in Attending Princeton
event.desc: In 1773, Hamilton was applying for Princeton.

event.label: Hamilton meets Burr, Laurens, Lafayette, and Mulligan
event.desc: The lyrics at the very beginning of the song mark 1776 as the year. The song introduces Hamilton to Aaron Burr, and three other prominent characters in the musical and history, John Laurens, Marquis de Lafayette, and Hercules Mulligan. This date is not historically accurate though as these men all met Hamilton at different times prior to 1776.
